title: Ruthenium nanoparticles decorated with surface hydroxyl and borate species boost overall seawater splitting via increased hydrophilicity
content:
Energy Environ. Sci., 2024, 17,3888-3897
DOI: 10.1039/D4EE00950A, Paper
Le-Wei Shen, Yong Wang, Ling Shen, Jiang-Bo Chen, Yu Liu, Ming-Xia Hu, Wen-Ying Zhao, Kang-Yi Xiong, Si-Ming Wu, Yi Lu, Jie Ying, Maria Magdalena Titirici, Christoph Janiak, Ge Tian, Xiao-Yu Yang
The surface hydroxyl and borate species in Ru–BOx–OH-300 nanocomposite have been evidenced to be crucial for efficient seawater electrolysis, due to the high hydrophilicity, optimized electronic structure of Ru, and weakened adsorption of Cl−.
